benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/admin/invoices - Trigger an invoice generation for all parked accounts

covered: POST Method - Validation: The tests cover validation for offset and limit values (negative, zero, non-integer) and verify required headers presence (X-Killbill-CreatedBy).
POST Method - Server Error Handling: The tests include 503 service unavailability and authorization error scenarios (missing/invalid token causing 401/403).
POST Method - Large Payloads/Volume: Tests exercise large datasets, including default limit, explicit offset/limit, maximum limit (1000), and extreme case (10,000).
Authorization: Tests ensure proper authorization handling with valid and invalid/expired tokens (TC08).

Edge Case Coverage: Tests cover no parked accounts, extra query parameters, partial input (offset only), maximum limits, backward compatibility and header parsing regressions (TC04, TC11, TC13, TC16, TC17).
Performance/Resilience: Tests validate retry semantics after transient network failures (TC15) and concurrent processing (TC18).
gaps: POST Method - Valid Payload: No defined payload structure or creation-related payload is tested (if a payload is required by API).
POST Method - Invalid Payload: No tests for malformed payloads beyond parameter validation (e.g., invalid JSON in body).
POST Method - Duplicate Submission: No test ensuring idempotency for duplicate POST submissions.
Rate Limiting: No tests for rate limiting or throttling of POST /1.0/kb/admin/invoices calls.
Caching Behavior: No tests validating caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) for this endpoint.
Pagination Validation: No explicit multi-page traversal tests beyond single-page offset/limit checks, especially on very large datasets.
Security - Header Robustness: While header injection test exists, additional exhaustive header sanitization/normalization tests are not present.
recommendations: Add tests for idempotency of duplicate submissions and for invalid payload formats if a payload is required.
Introduce rate limiting and caching header checks (ETag, Cache-Control) for the endpoint.
Add explicit multi-page pagination tests across large datasets to verify consistent ordering across pages.
Enhance security testing with more header normalization/sanitization checks beyond injection attempts.
Expand performance tests to include measurable response-time thresholds under heavy concurrent load and ensure per-account invoicing is 1:1 under concurrency.
